metadata.title: CVE-2016-10009 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Untrusted search path vulnerability in ssh-agent.c in ssh-agent in OpenSSHbefore 7.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary local PKCS#11modules by leveraging control over a forwarded agent-socket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.4p1-1
openssh-server - 1:7.4p1-1
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.4p1-1
openssh-tests - 1:7.4p1-1
ssh - 1:7.4p1-1
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.4p1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.4p1-1').
